description: Topological Logic Layer: Maps logical gates (AND, OR, XOR) to geometric operations on the Free Energy Manifold M. Formalizes 'Arguments' as Attractor Basins. Integrates with motion_law_v2.1.

theoretical_grounding.key_insight: Arguments are not propositions (true/false). They are BASINS OF ATTRACTION on a Free Energy landscape. Logic gates become geometric operations on these basins.
mathematical_basis: Morse Theory: Critical points of F define attractor topology
Dynamical Systems: Basin boundaries are separatrices
Information Geometry: Fisher metric defines distance between beliefs
theoretical_grounding.why_this_works: The motion law dξ/dt = -∇F drives states toward local minima. Each minimum is a 'stable worldview.' Logic operations query the GEOMETRY of these minima, not their propositional content.

manifold_M.math: Riemannian manifold (M, g) with g = Fisher metric, equipped with potential F: M → ℝ
manifold_M.dimension: dim(M) = number of independent belief parameters
manifold_M.notes: For Free Will debate: dim(M) = 2 (determinism axis, agency axis)

free_energy_landscape.interpretation: Height = surprise/incoherence. Valleys = stable worldviews. Ridges = tensions.
free_energy_landscape.notes: Gradient ∇F points uphill; motion law descends.

attractor_basin.math: B(ω) = { ξ ∈ M | lim_{t→∞} flow_t(ξ) = ω }
attractor_basin.interpretation: All initial conditions that eventually settle into worldview ω
attractor_basin.notes: Basin boundaries are fractal in chaotic systems, smooth in gradient flows.

separatrix.math: ∂B = { ξ ∈ M | ξ ∉ int(B(ω)) for any ω }
separatrix.interpretation: The 'ridge' separating basins. States here are unstable.
separatrix.notes: This is where XOR lives—the collision zone.

types.saddle: Unstable equilibrium (index 1+). A 'halfway house' between ideas.
types.maximum: Maximally incoherent state. Explodes under any perturbation.

AND_gate.topology: Set of states stable under BOTH worldviews

computation.interpretation: If non-empty: ideas are compatible. If empty: mutual exclusion.

AND_gate.physical_meaning: SYNTHESIS. The intersection is the 'common ground' where both ideas cohere.
AND_gate.failure_mode: If ∩ = ∅, need to find deeper basin C ⊃ (A ∪ B)

OR_gate.topology: Set of states stable under EITHER worldview

computation.interpretation: Agent can stably adopt either view; no commitment to synthesis

OR_gate.physical_meaning: SUPERPOSITION / AGNOSTICISM. Valid for branching hypotheses.
OR_gate.use_case: When evidence is insufficient to distinguish between equally viable theories

XOR_gate.topology: Region belonging to exactly one basin—the 'exclusive' zones

computation.method: Compute gradient field ∇F across basin boundaries

XOR_gate.physical_meaning: TENSION / GRADIENT. The collision zone where ideas maximally differ.
XOR_gate.interpretation: High gradient ⟹ strong conflict. This is where the Collider focuses energy.

NAND_gate.topology: All states NOT in the attractor basin of A

computation.method: Inject entropy ∇·J_S to push state out of basin A
computation.test: Does state return to A (robust) or find new basin (refinement)?

NAND_gate.physical_meaning: FALSIFICATION / STRESS TEST. Force the idea out of its comfort zone.
protocol: 3. If returns to ω_A: idea is ROBUST
4. If falls to ω_B where F(ω_B) < F(ω_A): idea REFINED
5. If diverges to F → ∞: idea FALSIFIED

XNOR_gate.topology: Test if basins have identical topology (homeomorphic)

computation.method: Compare Morse indices, basin volumes, boundary geometry

XNOR_gate.physical_meaning: EQUIVALENCE. Are these 'different words for the same idea'?
XNOR_gate.use_case: Detecting when apparent disagreements are merely terminological

collider_dynamics_v2.description: The Steel Man Collider as a path through topology

stage_1_initialization.action: Map input text → coordinates ξ₀ on M

stage_2_xor_stress.action: Identify negation basin B(ω_neg). Compute XOR region.
stage_2_xor_stress.output: Gradient field in A ⊕ B; locate max ||∇F||

stage_3_nand_purge.action: Inject entropy to push state into M \ A

stage_4_and_synthesis.action: Search for A ∩ B or deeper basin C
stage_4_and_synthesis.success_condition: F(C) < min(F(A), F(B)) AND C ⊃ features(A) ∪ features(B)
stage_4_and_synthesis.output: Steel-manned position at new attractor ω₃

trajectory_visualization.trajectory: Path from ξ₀ through XOR zone to synthesis

law_of_non_contradiction.interpretation: A state cannot simultaneously be stable and unstable for the same worldview

law_of_excluded_middle.caveat: Only holds for binary attractors. Multi-attractor systems have richer structure.
law_of_excluded_middle.interpretation: Every state belongs to some basin or its exterior

principle_of_explosion.interpretation: From maximum incoherence, any trajectory is possible (ex falso quodlibet)

basin_hierarchy.math: If ω₃ is global minimum, then B(ω₃) is the 'truth basin'
basin_hierarchy.interpretation: All other basins are local minima (partial truths) that can be refined toward ω₃

connection_to_motion_law.gradient_flow: dξ/dt = -∇_g F implements descent toward basin minima
connection_to_motion_law.rigidity_as_basin_depth: High ρ ⟺ deep, narrow basin (hard to escape)
connection_to_motion_law.reciprocity_as_basin_merging: High κ ⟺ basins tend to merge (synthesis favored)
connection_to_motion_law.lambda_as_basin_flattening: High λ ⟺ basins become shallower (easier to refine)

basins.B_det: Determinist basin: high determinism, low agency
basins.B_lib: Libertarian basin: low determinism, high agency

example_application.xor_region: The ridge between B_det and B_lib where tension is highest
example_application.synthesis_path: Trajectory from B_det through XOR ridge to B_comp
example_application.steel_man: Compatibilism as the attractor with lower F than either extreme
